repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:

Cannot remove a `@conceal` highlight when defined in a `highlights.scm`
file.

Solution:

Support a `@noconceal` highlight that works similarly to `@nospell` where it
overrides the conceal set on the range to remove it. Additionally, can
set the conceal metadata field to false for the same behavior.

closes #35085

comment_data.body: Need to error out if the type is neither string nor boolean

this logic looks suspicious. what is the purpose of the `metadata.conceal ~= nil` check, since if `metadata.conceal=false` it will fallthrough to the latter part anyway? also, use parens for clarity, since `a and b or c and d` is not obvious.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -410,14 +410,28 @@ local function on_line_impl(self, win, buf, line, on_spell, on_conceal)
 
             local spell, spell_pri_offset = get_spell(capture_name)
 
+            local is_noconceal = capture_name == 'noconceal'
+            -- The "conceal" attribute can be set at the pattern level or on a particular capture
+            local conceal_attr = metadata.conceal ~= nil and metadata.conceal
+              or metadata[capture] and metadata[capture].conceal

comment_data.body:
yea that's it, i can also just create an if statement so that it's abundantly clear:

```lua
local conceal_attr = metadata.conceal
if conceal_attr == nil then
  conceal_attr = metadata[capture] and metadata[capture].conceal
end
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -410,14 +410,28 @@ local function on_line_impl(self, win, buf, line, on_spell, on_conceal)
 
             local spell, spell_pri_offset = get_spell(capture_name)
 
+            local is_noconceal = capture_name == 'noconceal'
+            -- The "conceal" attribute can be set at the pattern level or on a particular capture
+            local conceal_attr = metadata.conceal ~= nil and metadata.conceal
+              or metadata[capture] and metadata[capture].conceal

comment_data.body: not asking for an if statement, just parens
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -410,14 +410,28 @@ local function on_line_impl(self, win, buf, line, on_spell, on_conceal)
 
             local spell, spell_pri_offset = get_spell(capture_name)
 
+            local is_noconceal = capture_name == 'noconceal'

comment_data.body: can this logic be simplified? using a ternary avoids the need for `---@type`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -410,14 +410,31 @@ local function on_line_impl(self, win, buf, line, on_spell, on_conceal)
 
             local spell, spell_pri_offset = get_spell(capture_name)
 
+            local is_noconceal = capture_name == 'noconceal'
+            -- The "conceal" attribute can be set at the pattern level or on a particular capture
+            local conceal_attr = metadata.conceal
+            if conceal_attr == nil then
+              conceal_attr = metadata[capture] and metadata[capture].conceal
+            end
+            local conceal ---@type boolean|string?
+            if is_noconceal then
+              conceal = false
+            else
+              conceal = conceal_attr

comment_data.body: please, use ternaries for simple cases. verbose code is a cost.

since we are changing this, let's tighten up the wording
```suggestion
        VALIDATE(hl.conceal_char && vim_isprintc(ch), "%s", "conceal char must be printable", {
```
do this check before the logic above, and avoid the nesting.

Could we use an unprintable character to mean "clear"? Maybe ^L. That simplifies the logic, the docs, and avoids expanding the type. It's quirky, but this feature is niche so could make sense. @bfredl @clason @zeertzjq WDYT

Most of the logic in this PR is just dealing with the potential boolean.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3049,11 +3049,15 @@ nvim_buf_set_extmark({buffer}, {ns_id}, {line}, {col}, {opts})
                   • cursorline_hl_group: highlight group used for the sign
                     column text when the cursor is on the same line as the
                     mark and 'cursorline' is enabled.
-                  • conceal: string which should be either empty or a single
-                    character. Enable concealing similar to |:syn-conceal|.
-                    When a character is supplied it is used as |:syn-cchar|.
-                    "hl_group" is used as highlight for the cchar if provided,
-                    otherwise it defaults to |hl-Conceal|.
+                  • conceal: either a boolean or a string.
+                    • when a string is given, it should be either empty or a

comment_data.body: From a consumer point of view I do prefer having the boolean instead of some random string. Though, we could make this clearer by exporting a constant for this in which case I would find this acceptable

+                  • conceal: either a boolean or a string.
+                    • when a string is given, it should be either empty or a

comment_data.body:
@justinmk I don't think this is a niche feature -- ever since we added conceal support, people have been asking for a way to disable _specific_ conceals. Right now, this either requires copying and modifying the bundled queries, or low-level and frankly hacky `disable_pattern()` calls. This PR could solve that issue nicely by just allowing a single targeted `@noconceal` pattern in a user query.

So I would say the logic needed for introducing this boolean is worth it.

comment_regular_data.body: would appreciate some guidance on what types of tests would be appropriate for this change, if this change would be accepted at all 🙏

~potential problem/todo, getting an error (while override still works):~ fixed, was trying to edit [this line](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/fccd016a0fba58dc4149aa046c00e05d9fd25a95/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/highlighter.lua#L438) to have the same logic for conceal as we do for spell, but seems like it doesn't apply so just left it the same.

title: feat(treesitter/extmark): support removing a conceal highlight
